moves.1. e4:
This is my first time at annotating a game. 

Having played this in june i will not be able to remember why i made certain moves but i will have a fair idea of what it will  lead to!

So we start with the kings pawn opening!
moves.2. c3: Attempting to bring his queen into the game
moves.2... g6: g6! Probably thinking along the lines of a fianchetto.
moves.3... f5: Applying pressure on the e4 square
moves.4... Bg7: ...and finishing the fianchetto which should have probably been done on the previous move
moves.5... b6: And again another fianchetto, attempting to gain control of the centre via the fianchettos
moves.6. Nf3 Bb7 7. Be3 Ne7: Preparing for d5 to attack the bishop on e3
moves.8. Nbd2 Nd5 9. Qe2 Nxe3:
I swap material. I always feel that bishops fair better in open games and knights on closed and tight games as most people do. (i think anyway) 

So with my bishops on the fianchetto i dont want his opposing bishops to counteract this.
moves.11. Nb3 Qe7 12. Be2 c5 13. Rd1 c4: Dont know why i did this
moves.15. Bxa6 Bc2 16. Ra1 Be4 17. Be2 Bxf3: This time i take the knight, hoping for gxBf3
moves.18... O-O: I castle and have both rooks lined up
moves.19. Ba6: Notice how well my opponents pawn structure is, he can pass freely without hinder due to his bishop on the white squares
moves.19... Bh6 20. O-O: He castles and looks very strong at the moment, his king is well defended and is a knight and a pawn up
moves.20... d5: Trying to gain control of the e file
moves.21. Nc1: He denies the en passant capture
moves.21... Qe8 22. Qg3 Qa4: Trying to attack his bishop and the c2 square which is his weak point in the pawn structure cause it can lead to the capture of b2
moves.23... Bd2: And i move it to safety, i cant afford to lose any more material
moves.25... g5 26. Qh3 Qc2: Sacrificing the bishop to attack his pawn structure
moves.27. Nb3 Qxb2 28. Qxh6 g4 29. Qg5+ Kh8 30: Remember how i wanted to attack from the sides, i think this plan failed :)
moves.32... Qe3+ 33. Kh1 Rfg8 34. Nc5 Rg6: Protecting the e6 pawn, and leading to rook to the h file to put pressure on his king
moves.35. g3: To protect his pawn on h2
moves.38... Rxg5: Removing the threat and attempting my first rook sacrifice
moves.39. Qd8+: He denies it, and i protect my king with it
moves.39... Rg8 40. Qxd5 Rg5 41. Bf1 Rg6 42. B: My first sacrifice, and now i need to get his queen of the a diagonal for my sacrifices to count
moves.43. Qxe6 gxh3: I have mate in two now, his last hope now is to move back on to the a diagonal but the lure of more material must have won my opponent over
moves.45... Qxg2#:
I think my main point of this game was to show you that everyone makes mistakes but if you keep fighting and making good moves you can still win. As i said this is my first annotated game so any input will be greatly appreciated.

I would like to thank my good friend mel-lo on a good game!
